newsitem.title: UK: Misys to buy U.S. software firm Frustum.
newsitem.headline: Misys to buy U.S. software firm Frustum.

text.p: British software company Misys Plc said on Tuesday it had conditionally agreed to purchase the whole share capital of privately-owned U.S. treasury managment software company The Frustum Group Inc.
The British company will pay a maximum total consideration of $61.4 million in cash, it said in a statement.
Frustum's main product is OPICS, an intgrated front and back office system for treasury management, typically sold as a deparmental system.
Misys said this would complement its existing products sold by its Midas-Kapiti International subsidiary.
Payment for Frustum will be split into initial consideration of $46.5 million and long term incentive compensation of up to $14.9 million.
It will also contribute up to $3.0 million for bonuses for non-vendor employees over the next two years, Misys added.
